meanings.definition: The quality of being able to understand or notice things easily.
meanings.sent1: Her perceptiveness allowed her to pick up on subtle cues that others missed.
meanings.sent2: His perceptiveness in reading people's emotions made him a great counselor.
meanings.sent3: With her keen perceptiveness, she could always tell when her cat was up to mischief.
meanings.sent4: His perceptiveness was like a finely tuned radar, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The detective's perceptiveness was so sharp, he could solve any case in record time.

meanings.definition: The ability to quickly and accurately understand things.
meanings.sent1: The child's perceptiveness in math allowed him to solve problems faster than his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She demonstrated her perceptiveness by grasping complex concepts with ease.
meanings.sent3: His perceptiveness in finding shortcuts in video games always amazed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's perceptiveness in predicting market trends was like having a crystal ball.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's perceptiveness in identifying students' needs helped them excel in their studies.
